event: Earliest human presence in present-day United States
Indigenous societies develop agriculture and regional cultures
Mississippian civilization builds large mound cities
European exploration of the Americas begins
St. Augustine is founded as the first permanent European settlement
Jamestown is founded as Englandâ€™s first lasting colony
Plymouth Colony is established by English settlers
British colonies expand along the Atlantic coast
French and Indian War reshapes control of North America
American Revolutionary War begins
Declaration of Independence is issued
United States Constitution is drafted
Bill of Rights is ratified
Louisiana Purchase doubles national territory
War of 1812 reinforces independence from Britain
Mexican-American War expands U.S. borders westward
Civil War begins between Union and Confederate states

Frontier expansion officially ends

Great Depression begins, reshaping economic policy
United States enters World War II after Pearl Harbor
United States emerges as a global superpower

Civil Rights Act advances legal equality
Apollo 11 lands the first humans on the Moon
